1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.1: Now in the eighteenth year of the reign of Jeroboam the son of Nabat, Abiam reigned over Juda.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.2: He reigned three years in Jerusalem: the name of his mother was<u>Maacha</u>the daughter of Abessalom.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.3: And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him: and his heart was not perfect with the Lord his God, as was the heart of David his father.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.4: But for David's sake the Lord his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.5: Because David had done that which was right in the eyes of the Lord, and had not turned aside from any thing that he commanded him, all the days of his life, except the matter of Urias the Hethite.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.6: But there was war between Roboam and Jeroboam all the time of his life.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.7: And the rest of the words of Abiam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the words of the days of the kings of Juda? And there was war between Abiam and Jeroboam.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.8: And Abiam slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David, and Asa his son reigned in his stead.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.9: So in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel, reigned Asa king of Juda,
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.10: And he reigned one and forty years in Jerusalem.<u>His mother</u>'s name was Maacha, the daughter of Abessalom.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.11: And Asa did that which was right in the sight of the Lord, as did David his father:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.12: And he took away the effeminate out of the land, and he removed all the filth of the idols, which his fathers had made.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.13: Moreover he also removed his mother Maacha, from being the princess in the sacrifices of Priapus, and in the grove which she had consecrated to him: and he destroyed her den, and broke in pieces the filthy idol, and burnt it by the torrent Cedron:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.14: But<u>the high places</u>he did not take away. Nevertheless the heart of Asa was<u>perfect with the Lord</u>all his days:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.15: And he brought in the things which his father had dedicated, and he had vowed, into the house of the Lord, silver and gold, and vessels.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.16: And there was war between Asa, and Baasa king of Israel all their days.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.17: And Baasa king of Israel went up against Juda, and built Rama, that no man might go out or come in, of the side of Asa king of Juda.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.18: Then Asa took all the silver and gold that remained in the treasures of the house of the Lord, and in the treasures of the king's house, and delivered it into the hands of his servants: and sent them to Benadad son of Tabremon the son of Hezion, king of Syria, who dwelt in Damascus, saying:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.19: There is a league between me and thee, and between my father and thy father: therefore I have sent thee presents of silver and gold: and I desire thee to come, and break thy league with Baasa king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.20: Benadad hearkening to king Asa, sent the captains of his army against the cities of Israel, and they smote Ahion, and Dan, and Abeldomum Maacha, and all Cenneroth, that is all the land of Nephtali.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.21: And when Baasa had heard this, he left off building Rama, and returned into Thersa.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.22: But king Asa sent word into all Juda, saying: Let no man be excused: and they took away the stones from Rama, and the timber thereof wherewith Baasa had been building, and with them Asa built Gabaa of Benjamin, and Maspha.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.23: But the rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his strength, and all that he did and the cities that he built, are they not written in the book of the words of the days of the kings of Juda? But in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.24: And he slept with his fathers, and was buried with them in the city of David his father. And Josaphat his son reigned in his place.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.25: But Nadab the son of Jeroboam reigned over Israel the second year of Asa king of Juda: and he reigned over Israel two years.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.26: And he did evil in the sight of the Lord, and walked in the ways of his father, and in his sins, wherewith he made Israel to sin.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.27: And Baasa the son of Ahias of the house of Issachar, conspired against him, and slew him in Gebbethon, which is a city of the Philistines: for Nadab and all Israel besieged Gebbethon.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.28: So Baasa slew him in the third year of Asa king of Juda, and reigned in his place.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.29: And when he was king he cut off all the house of Jeroboam: he left not so much as one soul of his seed, till he had utterly destroyed him, according to the word of the Lord, which he had spoken in the hand of Ahias the Silonite:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.30: Because of the sin of Jeroboam, which he had sinned, and wherewith he had made Israel to sin, and for the offence, wherewith he provoked the Lord the God of Israel.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.31: But the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the words of the days of the kings of Israel?
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.32: And there was war between Asa and Baasa the king of Israel all their days.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.33: In the third year of Asa king of Juda, Baasa the son of Ahias reigned over all Israel, in Thersa, four and twenty years.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.34: And he did evil before the Lord, and walked in the ways of Jeroboam, and in his sins, wherewith he made Israel to sin.
